newsitem.title: UK: BFI at four month high as Panamaxes lead the way.
newsitem.headline: BFI at four month high as Panamaxes lead the way.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) rose a further 23 points on Tuesday to 1,199, its highest since June 27 this year.

Panamaxes continued to set the pace for the BFI and brokers reported Despina 65,644 dwt fixed by Korea Line delivery USGulf mid-November for trip Far East at a firmer $13,250 daily plus $260,000 bonus.
The South African market was also strengthening and PAN Ocean were reported to have fixed Gortys 71,500 dwt delivery Richards Bay trip German North Sea in the region of $9,000/$9,500 daily.

On the BIFFEX moderate selling and profittaking emerged which made buyers nervous of a correction to the recent sharp rise and saw losses of between 12 and 20 points recorded by 1200 GMT. Turnover totalled 172 lots.

In a market report Cargill Investment Services said the physical market was still roaring ahead with shorts nervous of a tight November market, and higher fixtures were expected especially for USGulf/Far East. Higher bunker prices were also affecting rates, it added.
